Collection: recipes

The recipes collection is positioned as a pack of repeatable, multi-step orchestration flows: “recipes” for doing common tasks reliably.

What you get

  • Prebuilt workflows you can run or adapt
  • Profiles/agents that encourage structured multi-step execution

How it fits into the architecture

  • Recipes live “above” the kernel: they’re compositions of existing tools/modules plus instructions and structure.
  • They’re a way to standardize how work is done without embedding policy in the core.
Practical tip
If you like how Amplifier behaves for one task, a recipe/collection is the system’s intended way to package that behavior for reuse.
